title: fix(sdk): Don't send notifications for your own user
body:
I'm currently implementing notifications for fractal.

If I had e.g. element concurrently open and sent a message into a room, I would get a notification from fractal.

This fix avoids creating notifications originating from the userId of the client

title: refactor(crypto): Remove the dead pickle key
Preparing all the small things for release
body:
This PR contains all the works to make our crates ready for publishing to crates.io:

- [x] clean up `Cargo.toml` required Metadata, (e.g. `license`, `repository`)
- [x] set readme files for new crates
- [x] fix test-macros error
- [x] bump-versions where necessary
- [x] ensure everything builds (thanks to `cargo unleash`)

body:

- Reexport it from the sdk crate so it can be used.

title: [Breaking Change] Use boxed errors in StoreError
body:
Downstream applications may wish to implement their own StateStore/CryptoStore and may not use anyhow.

This commit switches the Database backend error from `anyhow::Error` to `Box<Error>`, which is more compatible with other rust error libraries.

### Migration Guide
If you are using anyhow or eyre, you need to map the error like this:

```rust
expr.map_err(|e| StoreError::Backend(e.into())
```

If your error types implement std::error::Error, you need to map the error like this:

```rust
expr.map_err(|e| StoreError::Backend(Box::new(e)))
```

Special thanks to @jplatte for the idea.

Replaces/Closes #643

title: Use OnceCell to store server versions
body:
Since the server versions isn't modified we can use a OnceCell and

title: fix(sled): Fix the compilation if only the cryptostore is enabled
body:
`make_store_config()` is enabled for both of the features we have in the sled crate, but `StoreConfig` was only imported if the `state-store` feature was enabled.

We're also building the `crypto-ffi` crate separately in the`xtask ci` target, which uses the sled store with the `crypto-store` feature, which makes sure we don't regress. Not sure if we want to add a separate `sled` target to `xtask`.

title: refactor(crypto): Simplify the verification object constructors
body:
This patch moves all the important identities that we need for verification into the already existing IdentitiesBeingVerified struct.

It adds a method to get those identities to the store, and streamlines our to-device and in-room verification constructors.

This is the first part of #399 and incidentally fixes a bug where the `started_from_request` flag wouldn't be set correctly for in-room verifications. The buggy constructor has been removed.

title: Put timeline behind a feature-flag
body:
Feature-gated with `experimental-timeline` for base, sled, indexeddb and the main SDK-crates.

Note: this has to use weak dependencies in order to allow proper switching it on from the main crate.

title: Handle redactions in BaseRoomInfo
body:
Redacting a `m.room.create` or `m.room.encryption` event is rather suspicious and a known wart in the spec. I implemented things in what I think might be the most reasonable way:

For create events, ignore redactions of a create event we have previously seen but accept redacted create events if we haven't previously seen an unredacted one (and then don't accept further ones just like in the unredacted case).

For encryption events, ignore both redactions and incoming already-redacted events (the latter because they contain no data, so are useless).

Part of #607.

title: Make matrix-sdk-common smaller
body:
I'm not a fan of common-dependency re-export crates, they're not very good at solving the problems they intend to solve. We haven't been maintaining this consistently anyways, so I think it's time to start removing things from it.

Ultimately, I would like to get rid of the `-common` crate entirely, but that's not realistic right now.

title: Weak feature dependencies
body:
This PR:
 - [x] switches to latest rust 1.60 as MSRV
 - [x] renames `encryption`-feature to `e2e-encryption` for clarity
 - [x] combines the `*-state-store`/`*-crypto-store` features into a single feature `sled` and `indexeddb` respectivly
 - [x] and combines them with weak `e2e-encryption`-dependencies to activate the features as necessary
 - [x] moves the code back to the sled-store, where it belongs
 - [x] updates the docs accordingly

fixes #562

title: Improve our timestamp handling for our sessions
body:
This PR mainly switches from an `Instant` to the Ruma type `SecondsSinceUnixEpoch`, the type, while not being fully WASM compatible, has the advantage that it can be easily serialized and deserialized.

Other E2EE implementations, i.e. the EA one, use Unix timestamps as well, so this eases up the migration as well.

title: replace lazy_static with once_cell
body:
fix #576 

Signed-off-by: cutecutecat <starkind1997@gmail.com>

title: Remove store_key
body:
- [x] replace store-key in state store with new crypto cipher
   - [x] in sled store
   - [x] in indexeddbstore
- [x] remove store-key from base-crate, including all feature references
- [x] add tests for encrypted store
  - [x] in sled store
  - [x] in indexeddbstore 
- [x] add key encryption to state store
   - [x] in sled store
   - [x] in indexeddbstore

Also improves some tests in the integration tests to be more expressive on errors.

_Notes_: this now uses the base64-crate to encode the `Vec<u8>` from the `hash_key` for the indexeddb store. It also encodes the usize as zero-leading-hex-value for the timeline, which might needs some adjusting if that is not sufficient. 

_Note 2_ on the cipher: Had to expose both the internal Encrypted type and the inner functions for indexeddb optimisations. All documented though.

title: Untangle the sled cryptostore
body:
This PR allows us again to use the sled cryptostore without the sled state store. Otherwise people that only use the `matrix-sdk-crypto` crate will implicitly depend on the `matrix-sdk-base` crate as well.

A bunch of `sled_cryptostore` specific methods were still part of the `matrix-sdk-crypto` crate as well, those were removed as well.

title: Fix the room key backup support in the crypto crate
body:
This PR fixes backup support in the crypto crate.  It's only used by Element Android and is not exposed through the main crate, so it was skipped by CI and accidentally broken by a couple of innocently looking PRs.

The `RecoverKey` struct is now available without the feature flag, so stores don't have to juggle the feature around.

This also adds a CI job to check that we don't rebreak it, an xtask is also provided for your convenience.

title: More refactorings…
body:
Keeping with the theme of trying to make working on the SDK easier, here's another set of improvements I found while browsing around.

The rustfmt thing was very interesting: For some reason format-on-save in that file just deleted all of the contents until I removed that rustfmt attribute.

title: Change store initialization
body:
context: https://matrix.to/#/!iYnZafYUoXkeVPOSQh:matrix.org/$yh6vVuOVhR_RWgdtHY6_HiFBgv_R-46TK-E-B3HwQlw?via=matrix.org&via=kde.org&via=one.ems.host

The main goal of this work is to remove the default magic that happens to create the stores and have something more explicit.

I ended up creating a mix of what was discussed as it made more sense to me looking at how the code is organized. By default I could have reused `BaseClientConfig` but it doesn't make sense to expose it in the main crate as the `BaseClient` doesn't mean anything there, so I created `StoreConfig`.

By default a `MemoryStore` is always used now. The stores have to be explicitely opened and provided to the `ClientConfig`. There are two helper functions to do that in the store crates `open_stores_with_*` and `make_config`.

title: Refactor request sending
body:
I would have liked to integrate ruma-client but it seems like due to wasm and request retrying¹ that's more involved.

¹ serializing the request once per retry would be a solution, but not a nice one
